ygData.msgSnippet: She guided the ship through the fire that engulfed ship as it skidded across the sky.  The hull was starting to melt in a few places. Come on baby, hold

She guided the ship through the fire that engulfed ship as it skidded 
across the sky.  The hull was starting to melt in a few places. 

"Come on baby, hold together long enough to get us to the ground. If 
you stay in one piece, I may get you flight worthy again. Just hang 
on until the ground at least."

She guided the ship towards a continent.  She watched as sthe ground 
went from looking far away to right in her face.  She held the nose 
up as she tried to fly a stone through the air. It went down.  
Crashing through trees, the wings torn off by trees, the rest of the 
tail was ripped off. She hit a tree head on. It sent the ship 
sideways.  It came to a hault against another tree, sideways.  She 
was still in the seat as the ship lights blinked and then lost all 
power.  She was leaning forward against the console, dazed and little 
shook up.  She sat back and looked around. A tree limb was hanging 
down through the front window.  The back half of the little ship was 
gone. She could see straight through the ship and looked at the trees 
outside.

She sighed, "Well, you may not have made it in one piece old girl, at 
we still made it together."  

She got up and went looking around the ship.  She found, under a pile 
of scrap, the beacon that would send a distress signal. She hoped 
that someday, someone would find her.

The beacon was neither Autobot or Decepticon. It was a neutral MAYDAY 
signal. It had been designed that in times of war, it would be able 
to be picked up by all, but not identified as being one allience or 
another.  Her insignia was also reversable.  Her parent's put that 
lttle design into her when they built her. After all, she was one of 
the few suvivors of the war. And her parent's designed her with the 
war in mind.

She managed to find her tool box.  She started to make minor repairs 
to the beat up ship to make herself more comfortable. After all, she 
had no idea of how long she would be there.
